# PostgreSQL connection details
import logging
import psycopg2
import os

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')
logger = logging.getLogger()

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

# PostgreSQL connection details
server = "juror-api-demo.postgres.database.azure.com"
database = "juror"
table = "juror_eric.voters_temp"

# SparkSession with PostgreSQL JDBC driver
spark = SparkSession.builder.appName("PostgreSQLManagedIdentity").getOrCreate()

# PostgreSQL JDBC URL with managed identity options
url = f"jdbc:postgresql://{server}/{database}?user={';'}&password={';'}&sslmode=require&authenticationPluginClassName=com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerMSIAuthentication"

try:
    # Read data from PostgreSQL
    df = spark.read.format("jdbc").option("url", url).option("dbtable", table).load()

    # Perform operations on the DataFrame (e.g., display data)
    df.show()

except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error: {e}")

finally:
    # Stop the SparkSession
    spark.stop()
